dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: SMEAGOL and his cousin, DEAGOL, sit in a SMALL CORACLE, their FISHING LINES draped over the side . . . S glinting off the surface of the water. An idyllic image. SUDDENLY . . . DEAGOL's FISHING ROD BENDS under the weigh LARGE FISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Smeagol, I've got one! (he laughs) I've got a fish, Smeagol!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) Go on, pull it in. DEAGOL pulls on his ROD, but is HAULED OVERBOARD and disappears underwater with a SPLASH! ANGLE ON: SMEAGOL leaning over the BOAT . . . CONCERNED. SMEAGOL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) Deagol!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: DEAGOL is towed to the RIVER BED by a LARGE FIS . . . he suddenly lets go of the line . . . eyes fixed on SHINING GOLD RING, lying in 'the SILT. Final Revision - October, 2003 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: DEAGOL climbs out of the WATER, onto the RIVER BANK. CLOSE ON: the RING   revealed in DEAGOL'S PALM . . . ANGLE ON: SMEAGOL peers over his shoulder . . . the GOLD reflects in SMEAGOL'S EYES! ON SOUNDTRACK: The HUM of the RING growing LOUDER . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us that, Deagol, my love! DEAGOL turns to look at him, a smirk on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? CLOSE ON: SMEAGOL moves towards DEAGOL . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because its my birthday, and I wants it. ANGLE ON: SMEAGOL jumps on DEAGOL . . . STRANGLING HIM! S rips the GLITTERING RING from DEAGOL'S LIMP HAND. SMEAGOL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My precious! CLOSE ON: SMEAGOL slips the RING onto his FINGER and DISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGES: SMEAGOL descending into madness. His body TWISTS DISTORTS . . . he becomes a CREEPY, SHRIVELLED wretch . . crawling into a DARK CAVE beneath the MISTY MOUNTAINS. SMEAGOL V/0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cursed us. Murderer. Murderer they called us. They cursed us and drove us away. (MВ°RE)                            (CONTINUED) Final Revision - October, 2003 3.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SMEAGOL V/0 (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we wept, Precious, we wept to be so alone. And we forgot the taste of bread, the sound of trees, the softness of the wind . . . We even forgot our own name. (in a choking cough)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gollum! Gollum! ANGLE ON: GOLLUM in the CAVE staring at the RING in his h GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine! My own. It came to me. SMEAGOL (ecstatic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: A GRIM LANDSCAPE, covered in THORN BUSHES and t scars of RECENT FIRES. The DARK MORGUL VALLEY disappears towards the MOUNTAINS. SETTLE ON: FRODO and SAM in a FILTHY CULVERT. SAM twitches in a RESTLESS SLEEP. But FRODO is awake . . hand trails down to the CHAIN around his NECK ... A SUDDEN HISS! FRODO quickly hides the RING as GOLLUM pee at them with GLEAMING EYES. GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up! Wake up! Wake up, sleepies! We must go, yes, we must go at once! SAM STIRS, looks at FRODO . . . SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you had any sleep, Mr Frodo? FRODO shakes his HEAD. SAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gone and had too much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 4.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SAM looks at the dead, BROWN TWILIGHT, below the LOWERING CLOUD. SAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be getting late. FRODO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No . . . no it isn't. It isn't midday yet. The days are growing darker. The GROUND suddenly QUIVERS, as a ROLLING, RUMBLING NOISE ECHOES down the VALLEY. GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, must go, no time ... SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not before Mr Frodo's had something to eat. GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . . no time to lose, silly. SAM shoots GOLLUM a HOSTILE LOOK and turns back to rummag his KNAPSACK. He holds up a piece of dried LEMBAS BREAD t FRODO. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. FRODO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? SAM (lying badly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry - leastways, not for lembas bread. FRODO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam. SAM (confessing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. We don't have that much left. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 5.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to be careful or we're going to run out. You go ahead and eat that, Mr Frodo. I've rationed it. There should be enough. FRODO looksa t SAM questioningly. FRODO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The journey home. FRODO says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE: FRODO and SAM follow GOLLUM as he leads them on the wining, torturous path ... clambering through BRACKEN and over JAGGED ROCKS. GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, Hobbitses. Very close now. Very close to Mordor! No safe places here. Hurry! Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE FOREST OF ISENGARD. DAY
dialogues.text: GANDALF leads ARAGORN, LEGOLAS, THEODEN and GIMLI through dark woodland . . . The MOVING FOREST of FANGORN ...opens before them . . . creating an AVENUE of TREES, which allows them access alo the old ISENGARD ROAD. A THICK, HUMID MIST fills the fore SUPER:             The Return of the King ANGLE ON: The FOEST SEPARATES ahead, REVEALING: the RUINS ISENGARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: All about, the GREAT STONE WALL is cracked and splintered into countless jagged shards.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Far off, half veiled int he swirling STEAM, the TOWER of ORTHANC stands ... Unbroken by the storm. Pale waters lap about its feet. ANGLE ON: TWO SMALL HOBBITS are sitting on the SMASHED WA . . . MERRY and PIPPIN! SPREAD before them is a feast of BREADS, MEATS and WINE. They PUFF on long pipes as they l back in the SUN. PIPPIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I ' m back at the Green Dragon, after a hard days work. MERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only, you've never done a hard days work. MERRY cuts PIPPIN off before he can respond in kind. MERRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, my Lords, to Isengard. GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: GANDALF, ARAGORN, LEGOLAS and GIMLI stare at th SIGHT before them . . . GIMLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You young rascals! A merry hunt you've led us on, and now we find you feasting and smoking. PIPPIN (mouth full)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are sitting on a field of victory, enjoying a few well-earned comforts. The salted pork is particularly good. GIMLI (suddenly interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salted pork? GANDALF (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hobbits!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 7.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're under orders from Treebeard, who's taken over management of Isengard. WIDE: GANDALF leads the company through the flotsam and jetsam which floats upon the muddied waters surrounding t TOWER ... TREEBEARD, the GIANT ENT, strides towards them, ALARMING all but GANDALF. TREEBEARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huraroom ... Young Master Gandalf, I'm glad you've come. Wood and water, stock and , stone I can master, but there's a wizard to be managed here ... Locked in his tower. GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there Saruman must remain, under your guard, Treebeard. GIMLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just have his head and be done with it.                            . GANDALF stares up the long length of the DARK TOWER . . . GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) No. He has no power any more. THE OLD ENT nods his head wisely . . . TREEBEARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The filth of Saruman is washing away ... Trees will come back to live here, young trees . . . wild trees. CLOSE ON: PIPPIN, his eye caught by something lying in th ANGLE ON: The MUDDY waters GLOWING wit a golden light . . ARAGORN turns as, quick as a FLASH, PIPPIN has jumped off ho rse an d pi cke d u p -- th e PA LAN TIR !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 8,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREEBEARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well bless my bark! GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent) Peregrin Took! I'll take that, my lad! PIPPIN doesn't move, his eyes staring in wonder at the sm black stone ... GANDALF (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly, now! RELUCTANTLY, PIPPIN hands the PALANTIR to GANDALF ... who immediately smothers it in his cloak. ANGLE ON: GANDALF looks back at PIPPIN . . . troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE: BACK SHOT - a GROUP OF RIDERS gallop towards the RO CITY of EDORAS . . . PUSH IN: EOWYN standing alone outside the GOLDEN HALL, waiting . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE: A ROARING FIRE; a LAMB ROASTING on SPI; LONG TABLES laden with FOOD; BARRELS of WINE; a banquet is-laid ready the returning soldiers. THEODEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight we remember those who gave their blood to defend this country. Hail the victorious dead! ANGLE ON: Amidst the cheering crowd, EOWYN moves towards ARAGORN . . . As she proffers the CHALICE their eyes meet EOWYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Westu Aragorn hal.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: EOWYN watches as ARAGORN moves away . . . a voice speaks ear. THEODEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am happy for you. EOWYN looks at her UNCLE, as THEODEN follows her gaze. THEODEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is an honourable man. EOWYN (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are both honourable men. THEODEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was not Theoden of Rohan who led our people to victory. EOWYN looks at him questioningly, disturbed'by his tone. T HE ODE N ( co nt' d)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't listen to me - you are young, and tonight is for you. ANGLE ON: EOWYN watches concerned as her UNCLE moves away ANGLE ON: MERRY & PIPPIN are in full voice, on top of TABLES . . . both hold very large mugs of ALE in their ha MERRY & PIPPIN (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you can search - up and down As many lands as can be found But you'll never find a beer so brown As the one we drink in our home town You can keep your fancy ales You can drink them by the flagon But the only brew, for the brave and true, Comes from the Green Dragon! ANGLE ON: GANDALF laughing and clapping the HOBBITS. ARAG steps up beside him, SMILING at the floorshow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 10,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ARAGORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No news of Frodo? GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No word ... nothing. ARAGORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We till have time. GANDALF turns quickly to ARAGORN. ARAGORN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day Frpdo moves closer to Mordor. GANDALF watches his friend's face . . . seeking reassuran GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we know that? ARAGORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) What does your heart tell you? GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a small smile) That Frodo is alive. (to himself) Yes - yes, he is alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRODO and SAM lie asleep amidst scrubby bushes stagnant pool. SMEAGOL lies nearby, muttering in his slee SMEAGOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too risky, too risky. The thieves! They stole it from us. Kill them . . . kill them ... kill them both! SMEAGOL wakes suddenly, shaking, his face drenched in SWE eyes wide in horror. SME AGO L (c ont' d)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 11.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GOLLUM (hissed whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh! Quiet! SMEAGOL'S features suddenly transform into the MALEVOLENT face of GOLLUM! GOLLUM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mustn't wake them, mustn't ruin it now! SMEAGOL casts a quick glance over his SHOULDER to the SLEEPING figures of FRODO and SAM as he clambers off his . . . silently sidling towards the EDGE of a STAGNANT POO SMEAGOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They knows, they knows, they suspects us. SMEAGOL stares into the MURKY depths of the WATER. The SURFACE RIPPLES as the face of GOLLUM appears as SMEA REFLECTION. GOLLUM.,               .     ,.В·

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it saying,.my Precious, my love? Is . Smeagol losing his nerve?? SMEAGOL                 :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Not! Never!! Smeagol hates nasty Hobbitses! Smeagol wants to see: them - dead! GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we will . . ,- Smeagol did it once. . . (sly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . . He can do it again. FLASH INSERT: SMEAGOL choking DEAGOL . . . Fingers locked around his THROAT. GOLLUM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ours - ours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 12,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SMEAGOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must get the Precious. We must get it back. GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience, patience, my love. First we must lead them to her. SMEAGOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lead them to the windy stairs. GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prompting) Yes, the stairs ... and then? SMEAGOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up, up, up, up the stairs we go . . . until we come to . . . (naughty excitement) ... the Tunnel! GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) And when they go in, there's no coming out. She's always hungry, she always needs to feed. She must eat, all She gets is filthy Orcses. SMEAGOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they doesn't taste very nice, does they, Precious?               . GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sinister) No . . . not very nice at all, my love. She hungers for sweeter meats . . . CLOSE ON: SAM . . . his EYES flicker OPEN . . . GOLLUM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hobbit meat." And when She throws away the bones and the empty clothes, then we will find it . . . SMEAGOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And take it for Me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 13

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting) For us . . . SMEAGOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we, we meant for us . . . (choking cough) Go Hum! Go Hum! GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sly) The Precious will be ours once the Hobbitses are dead! SUDDEN ANGLE ON: SAM image mirrored in the water as he SM GOLLUM on the HEAD with his POT! SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)            ,В·     . You treacherous little toad! SAM drops the POT and FLINGS himself ON TOP of GOLLUM! GO SCREAMS . . . his ARMS and LEGS FLAILING WILDLY! GOLLUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) No! Not! Help! Master! ANGLE ON: FRODO staggers over to SAM and PULLS HIM OFF GOLLUM. FRODO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sam! Leave him alone! CLOSE ON: GOLLUM, huddled on the ground        WHIMPERING SOBBING. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fuming) I heard it from his own mouth        he means to murder us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 14

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SMEAGOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never! Smeagol wouldn't hurt a fly! He's a horrid, fat Hobbit who hates Smeagol and who makes up nasty lies! SAM makes for SMEAGOL again . . . with a look of MURDEROU RAGE. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miserable little maggot! I'll stove your head in! FRODO grabs SAM'S ARM. FRODO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sm. . . a SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me a liar! You're a liar! FRODO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! If you scare him off, we're lost. SAM pulls away from FRODO . . . SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care! I can't do it, Mr Frodo. I won' t wait around for him to kill us ! FRODO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fierce whisper) I'm not sending him away. SAM stares at FRODO . . . at a loss. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't see it, do you? He's a villain! FRODO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowers voice) We can't do this by ourselves, Sam. Not without a guide. I need you on my side. ANGLE ON: SAM, his face softening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 15.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) I'm on your side, Mr Frodo. FRODO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Sam, I know. (whisper) You must trust me. FRODO beckons to GOLLUM. FRODO (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, Smeagol. GOLLUM turns slowly, staring at SAM through hooded, HATE- EYES ... and SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARAGORN joins LEGOLAS on the STEPS to the GOLDEN HALL, ob to the CHILL WIND . . . they look out across the SLEEPING the LOOMING MOUNTAIN RANGE BEYOND . .-. DARK CLOUDS mark LEGOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stars are veiled, something stirs in the east . . . A sleepless malice. LEGOLAS looks at ARAGORN . . . realisation in his face. LEGOLAS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eye of the enemy is moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: PIPPIN . . . he is AWAKE! He sits up . . . ANXI FIDGETY . . . Suddenly he hops out of bed and creeps towards the SLEEPI of GANDALF. MERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) What you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 16,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PIPPIN gasps with FRIGHT! MERRY is sitting up, wiping sle from his eyes. He moves on . . . ANGLE ON: A sleeping GANDALF lies with eyes wide open! Bu PIPPIN is undeterred . . . MERRY sits up, a worried look on his face. MERRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pippin? Pippin? Pippin! What are you doing? With quick stealth, PIPPIN lifts the WRAPPED PALANTIR fro GANDALF'S grasp ... MERRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pippin, are you mad? PIPPIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to look at it. Just one more time. MERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it back! Put - it - back! PIPPIN unwraps the PALANTIR and as MERRY looks on HORRIFI he gazes INTENTLY into it. MERRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pippin! As PIPPIN lays his hands on the CRYSTAL, a SICKLY PALE li slowly spreads from the GLASS BALL onto PIPPIN'S FACE ... EYES WIDEN. MERRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pippin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the STEPS of the GOLDEN HALL, LEGOLAS turns to ARAGORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is here.

dialogues.text: PIPPIN suddenly starts to HYPERVENTILATE . . . He STAGGER BACKWARDS, PALANTIR held rigidly before him . . . dialogues.text: Help! Someone help him! GANDALF wakes with a start! Just as ARAGORN enters, and wrenches the PALANTIR from PIPPIN'S HANDS . . . PIPPIN FA the FLOOR! . . . dialogues.text: Fool of a Took! GANDALF lifts the HOBBIT'S SLUMPED HEAD. MERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pippin! PIPPIN is trembling ... GANDALF calms him . . . PIPPIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gandalf! Forgive me. GANDALF             .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me! What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Revision - October, 2003 18.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PIPPIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disjointed) A tree ... There was a white tree . . . in a courtyard of stone . . . It was dead! FLASH INSERT: A lone white tree silhouetted by flames. PIPPIN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city was burning ... GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minas Tirith??? (to PIPPIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you saw? PIPPIN (terrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw . . . I saw him . . . I could hear his voice in my head. GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did you tell him? Speak! PIPPIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me my name, I didn't answer . . . he hurt me . . . CLOSE ON: GANDALF stares at PIPPIN with a FRIGHTENING INTENSITY . . . GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you tell him about Frodo and the Ring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEODEN stands in the GOLDEN HALL, gravely listening to GANDALF ... ARAGORN, LEGOLAS, and GIMLI look on . . . GANDALF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no lie in Pippin's eyes; a fool, but an honest fool he remains. He told Sauron nothing of Frodo and the Ring. ANGLE ON: GIMLI lets out a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GANDALF turns to look at THEODEN. GANDALF (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been strangely fortunate. What Pippin saw in the Palantir was a glimpse of our enemy's plan. GANDALF looks from on to the other of the, gathered compa GANDALF (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sauron moves to strike the city of Minas Tirith. His defeat at Helm's Deep showed our enemy one thing. The WIZARD turns towards ARAGORN . . . GANDALF (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heir of Elendil has come forth. Men are not as weak as he supposed. There is courage still - strength enough left to challenge him. THEODEN listens intently, saying nothing. GANDALF (cont'd) (wa rningly)
